_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary

Facility:Maverick Fertilizer
City:Burwell
Contact:Mark Freeman
Phone:308-346-4952

1. Facility Policy.

      The owner's,management,and employees of Maverick Fertilizer are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to persons and the environment.

2. Facility Information.
     
     The primary activity at the facility is the storage of fertilizers for sale to farmers. Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production. The maximum quantity stored would be 190,000 pounds in  storage and nurse tanks.   
   

3. Accidental Release Prevention Program.

      This facility is in compliance with the provisions of "Safety Requirments for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61, published by The American National Standards Institute , In., (ANSI) , and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration(OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia". The OSHA standard is referenced in this RMP Registration Form, see Section 8.3(b).

4. Five-year Accident History.

        There have been no accidental  releases of anhydrous ammonia in the last five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility;nor, to our knowledge, has THERE BEEN ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuation, property damage, or environmental damage.

5. Emergency Response Program.

     The facility has:
     a. A written action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38;

     b.Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and communtiy right-to-know information as requred under SARA Title III (EPCRA).

6. Planned Changes to Impr

ove Safety

       Safety improvements are an on-going processes at this facility. Periodic evaluations are preformed to assess the maintenance and safe condition of our equipment.There are no specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations at this time.

7. For further information contact; Mark Freeman at 308-346-5338
